metadata.title: CVE-2014-1591 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla Firefox 33.0 and SeaMonkey before 2.31 include path strings in CSPviolation reports, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitiveinformation via a web site that receives a report after a redirect.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
